abstract.text: A proxy that can launch, monitor, and terminate a test application.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Use this class to launch, monitor, and terminate your app in a UI test. Use
to launch your app and wait for it to reach an expected state before you check test conditions.

abstract.text: Replicate sequences of interactions and make sure that your appâ€™s user interface behaves as intended.
A proxy that can launch, monitor, and terminate a test application.
The possible states of an application during UI testing.
Activates the application.
Creates a proxy for the application thatâ€™s configured as the Target Application in Xcodeâ€™s target settings.
Creates a proxy for an application for the specified bundle identifier.
Creates a proxy for the application at the specified file system URL.
Launches the application.
The arguments that pass to the application on launch.
The environment variables that pass to the application on launch.
Creates a proxy for the application specified as the Target Application in Xcodeâ€™s target settings.
Launches the application by URL.
Resets the authorization status for a protected resource.
The most recent state of the application.
Terminates any running instance of the application.
Waits for the application to reach the specified state or timeout.
A UI element in an application.
Attributes exposed by UI elements.
A method to capture a snapshot of an elementâ€™s attributes and descendant user interface hierarchy.
A type that provides ready-made queries for locating descendant UI elements.
A system resource that requires user authorization to access.
A type that can provide a screenshot of its current UI state.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
